bboxes.raw_text:
NEW ORLEANS A former
freedom rider, 70 year old
teacher from Denver, said the de-
cision last week Of the United
States Supreme Court that she
was not In contempt Of an Ala
bama court. will raise the status
of Negroes in the South.


Mary Hamilton, a Negro. a
field secretary for the Congress
of Racial Equality (CORE), has
served SO days in jail in civil
rights cases in Mississippi. Ala
bama, New York and New Jer-
sey.


She would not answer author
tiles in Cadsden, Ala.s after po-
lice arrested her in June. 1868,
unless she was addressed as
"Miss Hamilton


: While being questioned by the
county solicitor Richmond Flow
ers, she continually refused to
answer and said. "My name is
Miss Hamilton


Miss Hamilton was sentenced
to jail on a contempt charge and
given a $50 fine.


She said using the first names
of Negroes is an old southern
custom which has been a bitter
pill to swallow. She said in the
small rural areas the prosecutor
may continue to call Negroes by
their first names, but now Ne
groes can legally object.

Willis E. Boykins of Washing
ton, a steward first class in the
u. S. Navy, has been awarded
aircrewman's wings at San Diego,
Calf.


Boyhns, brother of ]. H. Boy
kins of 1887 E. Taylor, has
served as steward on Vice Ad-
miral Paul D. Stroop's Super
Constellation aircraft for the past
~ years and under the admiral
for l6 of his l9years in the Navy.

Guild Am American
Methodist Church, 1875 No.
Central.


planning Mesdames Everett B.
Luther Sana McChester John Hober Mary Vail and Miss Ar
Seneca, guild president.


Participants the II Am American which will be held
Central Methodist Church Misses Beverly Graves
Lorans Newman and Edna. Nesen: - ,5.. -.

WINS MISS"
DECISION

She would not answer author

their first names, but now Ne
groes can legally object.

full articles.headline:
Willis Boykins Wins
Crewmun's Wings
full articles.article:
Willis E. Boykins of Washing
ton, a steward first class in the
u. S. Navy, has been awarded
aircrewman's wings at San Diego,
Calf.


Boyhns, brother of ]. H. Boy
kins of 1887 E. Taylor, has
served as steward on Vice Ad-
miral Paul D. Stroop's Super
Constellation aircraft for the past
~ years and under the admiral
for l6 of his l9years in the Navy.
